citations.narrative:
Of the 28 puppies at the facility, 15 of them were missing from the APHIS form 7005 Record of Acquisition and Dogs on
Hand. The facility maintains its own paper intake forms and then transfers that information onto the APHIS form 7005 but
reports they got behind. It is important to maintain an updated Record of Acquisition and Dogs on Hand for ease of
inspection, tracking movements of animals, and for recovery in instances of loss or theft. Correct by ensuring the APHIS
form 7005 is regularly maintained with up-to-date information of the puppies at the facility. Correct by: August 17, 2023.

There is an excessive accumulation of hair, dirt, and debris on the sides of two enclosures and on the bungie cords
holding the self-feeders onto the enclosures. On one set of top and bottom- style enclosure there is a buildup of hair and
brown organic material stuck around the woven wire sides of the enclosure. There is one puppy in each enclosure. On
another similar style enclosure, the bungie cords used to attach the self-feeders onto the enclosures have an excessive
accumulation of hair wrapped around the spring and cord. There is also some accumulation of brown organic debris stuck
to the wiring on the top of the bottom enclosure and along the bottom and side of the top enclosure. Accumulations of
hair, excreta, and other organic debris can draw pests, be a source of bad odors, and can harbor bacteria and other
pathogens. Correct by ensuring all hard surfaces in which the dogs come into contact be cleaned and sanitized as often
as necessary (a minimum of every 2 weeks) to prevent accumulation of debris and excreta. Correct by: August 17, 2023.

There were approximately 5 stainless steel self-feeders that contained moldy puppy food. The pieces of dry puppy food
were fuzzy, white-grey, and in one instance, caked onto the bottom of the feeder. The enclosures these feeders were
attached to did not currently house any puppies. Having moldy food in the feeders is problematic in case a puppy was to
be housed in the enclosure and subsequently ingest the food. Additionally, moldy food could increase the potential for
attracting pests and causing unpleasant odors in the kennel. It is unclear when the feeders were last cleaned and
sanitized. Food receptacles must be kept clean and sanitized at least once every 2 weeks. Correct by implementing a
cleaning plan which ensures the food receptacles are routinely cleaned and monitored so that there is no molding,
deterioration, or caking of the food. Correct by: August 15, 2023. Corrected at the time of inspection.

Water was not continuously available to 8 puppies. Upon arriving at the facility, one Dachshund puppy and one Shih Tzu
puppy were in a small, fenced-in enclosure in the grass and did not have a bowl of water. Inside the facility there was a
large kennel with 6 poodle mix puppies who also did not have access to water. The facility representative stated the
puppies were out of their normal enclosures for exercise. When asked by the inspector, the facility representative gave
both groups of puppies a bowl of water. The puppies were observed to only play in the water, not drink. There is a risk of
dehydration, stress, and overheating if water is not available, especially in the summer (environmental temperature is 85
degrees F today). Correct by ensuring potable water be continuously available to dogs, even while out of their normal
enclosure for exercise. Correct by: August 11, 2023. This was corrected at the time of inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Of the 28 puppies at the facility, 15 of them were missing from the APHIS form 7005 Record of Acquisition and Dogs on 
Hand. The facility maintains its own paper intake forms and then transfers that information onto the APHIS form 7005 but 
reports they got behind. It is important to maintain an updated Record of Acquisition and Dogs on Hand for ease of 
inspection, tracking movements of animals, and for recovery in instances of loss or theft. Correct by ensuring the APHIS 
form 7005 is regularly maintained with up-to-date information of the puppies at the facility. Correct by: August 17, 2023. 
3.1(c)(3) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
There is an excessive accumulation of hair, dirt, and debris on the sides of two enclosures and on the bungie cords 
holding the self-feeders onto the enclosures. On one set of top and bottom- style enclosure there is a buildup of hair and 
brown organic material stuck around the woven wire sides of the enclosure. There is one puppy in each enclosure. On 
another similar style enclosure, the bungie cords used to attach the self-feeders onto the enclosures have an excessive 
accumulation of hair wrapped around the spring and cord. There is also some accumulation of brown organic debris stuck 
to the wiring on the top of the bottom enclosure and along the bottom and side of the top enclosure. Accumulations of 
hair, excreta, and other organic debris can draw pests, be a source of bad odors, and can harbor bacteria and other 
pathogens. Correct by ensuring all hard surfaces in which the dogs come into contact be cleaned and sanitized as often 
as necessary (a minimum of every 2 weeks) to prevent accumulation of debris and excreta. Correct by: August 17, 2023. 
3.9(b) 
   
Feeding 
There were approximately 5 stainless steel self-feeders that contained moldy puppy food. The pieces of dry puppy food 
were fuzzy, white-grey, and in one instance, caked onto the bottom of the feeder. The enclosures these feeders were 
attached to did not currently house any puppies. Having moldy food in the feeders is problematic in case a puppy was to 
be housed in the enclosure and subsequently ingest the food. Additionally, moldy food could increase the potential for 
attracting pests and causing unpleasant odors in the kennel. It is unclear when the feeders were last cleaned and 
sanitized. Food receptacles must be kept clean and sanitized at least once every 2 weeks. Correct by implementing a 
cleaning plan which ensures the food receptacles are routinely cleaned and monitored so that there is no molding, 
deterioration, or caking of the food. Correct by: August 15, 2023. Corrected at the time of inspection.

3.10(a) 
   
Watering 
Water was not continuously available to 8 puppies. Upon arriving at the facility, one Dachshund puppy and one Shih Tzu 
puppy were in a small, fenced-in enclosure in the grass and did not have a bowl of water. Inside the facility there was a 
large kennel with 6 poodle mix puppies who also did not have access to water. The facility representative stated the 
puppies were out of their normal enclosures for exercise. When asked by the inspector, the facility representative gave 
both groups of puppies a bowl of water. The puppies were observed to only play in the water, not drink. There is a risk of 
dehydration, stress, and overheating if water is not available, especially in the summer (environmental temperature is 85 
degrees F today). Correct by ensuring potable water be continuously available to dogs, even while out of their normal 
enclosure for exercise. Correct by: August 11, 2023. This was corrected at the time of inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
